justification: Offer ignores Team B’s conservative, floor-focused mindset and their value on workhorse RBs; Ryan Taylor is exactly their archetype. Return pieces are a questionable committee RB (Liam Green), a fringe committee RB (Trey Mitchell), and a low-tier, high-variance WR (Marcus Taylor), which don’t match B’s preferences (possession WR with steady targets, proven vets). Rationale centers only on Team A. Trade is structurally feasible as a 3-for-1 but misaligned with B’s needs, making acceptance unlikely.
